etymology.description: semantic 囗(囗) (wéi, "closure") + phonetic 或(或) (huò, "or") -> enclosed area signifying a state or country
etymology.interpretation: The character 國(國) (guó, "country") combines the idea of an enclosed space from 囗(囗) (wéi, "closure") with the phonetic component 或(或) (huò, "or"), suggesting a defined and protected area, aligning with the concept of a country or state.
etymology.simplification: The simplified character 国(國) uses 玉(玉) (yù, "jade") as a mnemonic for wealth within an enclosure, dropping the component 或(或) (huò, "or") for simplicity.

examples.chinese: 这个国有着独特魅力(這個國有著獨特魅力)。
examples.english: This country has a unique charm.

examples.chinese: 许多人热爱国文化(許多人熱愛國文化)，努力建设国的美好明天(努力建設國的美好明天)。
examples.pinyin: Xǔduō rén rè'ài guó wénhuà, nǔlì jiànshè guó de měihǎo míngtiān.
examples.english: Many people cherish their country's culture and strive to build a better future.
